intro: Cyrtandra bracteolosa, commonly known as the bracteolosa heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Cyrtandra bracteolosa is known for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight.
